Class CurvedMirror

  • java.lang.Object
    • GameObject
      • Mirror
        • CurvedMirror
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ConcaveMirror

    public class CurvedMirror
extends Mirror
    The "CurvedMirror" class, a convex shaped mirror (inside of a ricle) which also has the ability to reflect lasers by creating a new laser based on where the old laser hit the mirror, and at what angle.
    Version:
    V1.0.0, 10 June, 2014
    Author:
    Erik Trinh

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CurvedMirror(int x, int y, int width, int height, boolean side, java.awt.image.BufferedImage icon)
      A constructor for the class, sets the x-coord, y-coord, width, height, side which is reflective.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean contains(java.awt.geom.Point2D point)
      Checks if this point is found in the Ellipse2D or circle.
      double findTangentSlope(int y)
      Returns the slope of the tangent of this circle at point (x, y), where the y value is specified.
      double findXCoord(double y)
      Returns the x-coordinate of this mirror given the y-coordinate.
      int getCentreX()
      Returns the x component of the centre of the circle.
      int getCentreY()
      Returns the y component of the centre of the circle.
      java.awt.geom.Ellipse2D getCircle()
      Returns the Ellipse2D of this object.
      int getRadius()
      Returns the radius.
      boolean getReflectSide()
      Returns a boolean for which side is reflective, false for right side, true for left side.
      Laser reflect(Laser laser)
      Returns a new reflected laser with a starting point of the old laser's ending point, and a new angle calculated on the slope of the tangent the old laser hit the mirror at, and the old laser's angle.
      int slopeToAngle(double slope)
      Returns the integer of the angle value (in degrees with up/forward/north being 0, and going clockwise) of a slope of a line.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CurvedMirror

        public CurvedMirror(int x,
            int y,
            int width,
            int height,
            boolean side,
            java.awt.image.BufferedImage icon)
        A constructor for the class, sets the x-coord, y-coord, width, height, side which is reflective. Also sets up the Ellipse2D or circle, and calculates the centre of it, and the radius.
        Parameters:
        x - int for the x-coord.
        y - int for the y-coord.
        width - int for the width.
        height - int for the height.
        side - boolean for which side is reflective, false for right, true for left.
        icon - BufferedImage, stores the image used for the mirror.

    • Method Detail

      • reflect

        public Laser reflect(Laser laser)
        Returns a new reflected laser with a starting point of the old laser's ending point, and a new angle calculated on the slope of the tangent the old laser hit the mirror at, and the old laser's angle.
        Overrides:
        reflect in class Mirror
        Parameters:
        laser - Laser which hit the mirror, which this function will create a reflected laser of
        Returns:
        a new reflected laser with newly calculated angle and starting coordinates.

      • findXCoord

        public double findXCoord(double y)
        Returns the x-coordinate of this mirror given the y-coordinate.
        Parameters:
        y - double for the y-coordinate used to find the corresponding x-coordinate of this circle/mirror.
        temp - double, temporary value used to calculation of the y-coordinate.
        Returns:
        the double value of the x-coordinate corresponding to this y-coordinate.

      • findTangentSlope

        public double findTangentSlope(int y)
        Returns the slope of the tangent of this circle at point (x, y), where the y value is specified.
        Parameters:
        y - int for the y-component of the point to find the slope of the tangent at.
        Returns:
        a double representing the slope of the tangent at the point.

      • slopeToAngle

        public int slopeToAngle(double slope)
        Returns the integer of the angle value (in degrees with up/forward/north being 0, and going clockwise) of a slope of a line.
        Parameters:
        slope - double, stores the slope of the line used to calculate the angle.
        angle - int, stores the calculation of the angle.
        Returns:
        angle int, the angle calculated that will be return.

      • contains

        public boolean contains(java.awt.geom.Point2D point)
        Checks if this point is found in the Ellipse2D or circle. Returns true if it is, and false if it is not.
        Overrides:
        contains in class Mirror
        Parameters:
        point - the Point2D to be checked.
        Returns:
        true if the point is contained in the Ellipse, false if not.
